Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: Jeca_ETF
Reviews.Content: Shortly: + Rooms are clean and towels are replaced daily + Breakfast is good, there is something for everyone + Near the tram station and takes about 20 minutes walk to Sultanahmet (the centre of the Old town) - The view from the rooms is not very pleasant - Some of the service is unkind - Thin walls

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,nice people and verry good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cristianfagadar
Reviews.Content: first I must say that this hotel is verry clean,people are nice and food is great.second is in centre of Istanbul near railway transport.enjoy it I guarantee that you will be pleased:is cheap and food is great!Has olso pool on the roof!The view from the restaurant is over the Bosfor.

Reviews.Title: “Let's dispel some myths”
Reviews.Author: stuart d
Reviews.Content: OK, so firstly the roadworks are completed, its now pedestrianised outside, so no noise from traffic or roadworks. Secondly you still have to avoid falling into basement shops as you walk around the district, but that's hardly the hotels fault. Thirdly, the staff are NOT rude and scary, in fact they are very friendly and helpful, but the language barrier can make them appear surly or just plain "baffled", you need to persist... I had a room that was more box like than room, and the small window looked out into a void that contained all of the hotels air conditioning units. Unpleasant. I have read about this room in other reviews, so maybe there are a few like it. That said the room was comfortable and clean. The bed was comfortable, and the en-suite all worked as it should. A free to use valuables safe was contained in the wardrobe. The hotel provided a very good breakfast, but the same restaurant in the evening was not so good, it seemed no-one was using it much, so most of the menu was not available. The hotel is located a few yards from Taksuray tram station, which is four stops from the Blue Mosque, Tokapi Palace and Hagia Sofia complex, and only 2TL for a ticket, so very well located for touring. Its also only a short walk to Grand Bazaar. However being in the shopping area, its not the best place for external restaurants, you need to travel back to the tourist areas, or to the bazaar areas for the best meals. A metro (also 2TL) will get you to Taksuray (Metro) station in 30 minutes from the airport, it is then a short walk to the tram station and then to the hotel., so very cheap to travel in and easy to locate.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy, unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: L W
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ok. When we arrived only the doorman was at reception and we had to wait quite a while until the receptionist arrived to do the check in (we arrived at 9am). Room very small and dirty - hairs over the floor and shower. Bed however comfortable. The walls are very thin and the street quite noisy. On our second morning there was no hot water for over 3 hours. After a long wait luke warm water was available. The receptionist was very unhelpful and unfriendly. Istabul is a great city though - dispite the crappy hotel the trip was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious room”
Reviews.Author: sarebear007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in transit Perhaps we lucked out we booked a twin room, and received a twin room with a extra room that had a double bed in it.. Had huge windows that didn't look out to much except the street Only negative was and this was only minor that someone upstairs had very heavy feet and stomped around all night, and the kitchen which must have been nearby- up the stairs outside our hotel room door I believe- was very noisy particularly in the morning But the room itself was clean, spacious, bathroom was also clean so all in all it was a good stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and best”
Reviews.Author: AbudhabiUnknown
Reviews.Content: Cheap and best.. good hospitality... clean rooms and good breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Never using this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Roua G
Reviews.Content: 1. The reception staff was unfriendly, giving wrong advice, not informed and not willing to help with tourist info 2. The room was not cleaned: only the trash was taken and the beds were arranged, but the dust stayed there for the whole trip 3. In the room was very hot and the air conditioned wasn't working properly. 4. One good thing: the silence (well the other guests were noisy, sometimes very noisy, but that's not the hotel's fault) 5. The breakfast was the same every day and very poor; no variety; very few choices. 6. Restaurant stuff looked bored. 7. The view from the restaurant was awesome! 8. We got a room that did't have any view, and when I say "any view" I mean it: the window opened to a hole, I could only see 4 other walls, dark, some cables and some apparatus making a strange noise. If you ever go to this hotel avoid rooms: 1101, 1201, 1301 etc. In my opinion, these rooms had to be transformed into small warehouses. 9. No minibar in the room: only a small empty fridge (which by the way I couldn't open at first because a bed was positioned exactly in front of the fridge door)

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well located”
Reviews.Author: Villius
Reviews.Content: The rooftop restaurant, overlooking the Sea of Mamara was a great place for breakfast. Room OK. Had a blown light globe, but they fixed it, soon enough. Hotel just a short walk to Ataturk Street, with it's eateries and money changers.

Reviews.Title: “You can find much better!”
Reviews.Author: kaitlandAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Both my partner and I stayed here recently. The first thing we noticed was the unfriendly attitude of the desk staff, one male in particular. We checked in and returned to him to find directions to eating places nearby. He just pointed to his left and that was it!!!! Then mumbled something he must have thought was funny. We also had the pleasure of his company on check out. The hotel was supposed to notify us when our transfer had arrived, but this guy completely ignored the transfer guy and us. He was the rudest guy I have ever come across at a hotel reception. The hotel itself is reasonabl. Rooms can be a bit cold, especiallly when the A/C does not work. We complained several time re this but helpful harry at the desk just ignored our requests. The breakfast is amazing. I think it is aimed for the Russian travellers as you would not believe what is served. Chips and hot dogs, beetroot etc?/ and the toaster is hopeless. Rooms on the upper level are noisy at night, especially street noise. The windows need insulation. When you leave this hotel, you have to be careful not to fall down the sunken entrances to nearby businesses. Overall, i would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: lale1996
Reviews.Content: The area of the hotel is not brilliant - we did not go out after dark as it was a bit of a strange area. The nearest tram stop is Aksaray which is about 5 minute walk away. We paid Â£250 for the week for two so did not expect much. The hotel was very clean. Reception staff were efficient but not too friendly. Pool area very small. Breakfast consisted of bread, eggs, cheese, olives etc but also they served soup and sausages and chips. No alcohol was served in the downstairs bar which was a shame as the area was very comfortable - to get an alcoholic drink you had to go to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: photobugSM
Reviews.Content: Situated just a few minutes walk from the tram line and only a couple stops away from all the main sights is the plus about this hotel. Unfriendly staff and dirty room (hair and dirt on the floor when we arrived, hair on the sheets!). We had booked a double but recieved a twin. Breakfast was OK but tasteless and void of anything healthy, it consisted of dry buns & bread, tasteless cheese and turkish (?) pink sausages and chips... The sourrounding area consists of mainly clothes shops and a good walk is required for dinner, as there are not many restaurants nearby, with the exception of three just down the road. This does not matter that much though, there are many good ones in Sulthanamet, where the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sofia are located. Hotel restaurant is on the top floor overlooking the Bosphorous. Hotel is cramed in between other very tall buildings (common in Istanbul), so dont expect a good view unless maybe you stay at the top.. It was a fairly cheap hotel compared to some we looked at, and the standard is acordingly, but for me, a clean room and friendly staff are more important than standard, and sadly this was just not the case with Grand Ons. Very slow but free Wifi Available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovinthesun26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days. The room was excellent, clean & tidy. Room was cleaned everyday & the staff here, apart from one, were very good & friendly. The communal areas were a very good standard. We arrived late evening & decided to eat in the hotel restaurant rather then going out, however, the quality of the food was very poor & was very expensive. We had booked for B&B but the breakfast was the same everyday, it was a poor standard and no matter what time we seemed to go it seemed like it had been sat there for a long time. One thing which did seem strange was that they served chips & hotdog style sausages for breakfast everyday. The hotel was advertised as only being a 10 minute walk away from the old city & tourist area, however it took us nearly 30 mins walk to get to the Blue mosque area. We spent most of our time in Taskim in the New City & this hotel was just too far away from there. The hotel is just around the corner from the main bus route & Metro stop, the public transport is very cheap. There were several hotels. bars & restaurants around the hotel, some were reasonably priced others not. Laleli appears to have a large Russian tourist base, so much so large number of the shop signs were in Russian. The Hotel seemed to cater more towards a Russian client, and we were the only Turkish/English guests. Apart from the food, we had no problem with this hotel itself, probably one of the better hotels we have stayed at in Turkey. One thing that would put us off staying here again is how far away from the New CIty it is, as that is where we choose to spend out time.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming staf,very helpful.. The...”
Reviews.Author: alayousef
Reviews.Content: very welcoming staf,very helpful.. The breakfast was excellant,every thing was perfict for 3 star hotel.. I love it os much.. Special thank to Mr.Fikry,who allwys helped us & gave us the write advise.. Thank you so much Grand Ons..

Reviews.Title: “A VERY BASIC HOTEL AND DEFINITELY NOT A 3 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MavisDubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in the second week of May. The hotel is away from the Sultanamet Square but this did not bother us much as we had taken the tours for the first 3 days of our stay. On the second day of our stay we returned at 10.30pm from our tour to Bursa and found that the AC was not functioning and asked for another room for which we were refused as all the rooms were booked. The next day we were given another room and when we returned from our tour we found that the Ac in this room was not functioning so we got a different room. In this room the bathroom was without a lock and room was not very clean. Also, the receptionist was not very helpful when we asked him to call up our tour agent. The breakfast was Ok. On the whole we were not very happy with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: DM2008
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 day break to this hotel through City Breaks UK.com for my sons 20th birthday. I read the reviews here and was a little concerned that the place might not be good. I need not have worried, the hotel is been refurbished and we got one of the new rooms and very nice they are too, nothing fancy just clean tidy and functional. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is near to the tram, all the major attractions are a short journy away, the tram is 1.5TL per journey and runs right over to the asian side. There is also a Metro station (Aksaray) near to the hotel, we used this to get to the Forum shopping mall (Get off at Kartaltepe) which is supposed to be the biggest in Europe. It has a new ice museum, a fantastic aquarium and some nice places to eat or have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, really”
Reviews.Author: devsirma
Reviews.Content: Well, it's very good location, better than you are in Sultanahmet, because walking to the see sights (15 min. from this hotel) you can see a lot of off the Istanbul, plus Kapali carsi (Grand Bazar) is on the way to Aya Sofia, Blue mosque and Topkapi Saray. Accomodation is excellent, we had excellent room on 8. fluor with view to seaside and restaurant above the room. Bathroom is very good, clean, also room. But, please be careful about equipment or furniture, it is not stability, and if you brake something they will charge you double or triple price of the normal price of the part you brake. In my case I broke cap of the wc toillet and they charge it too, too much, unbelievable. Even I insist to speak to manager of the hotel they delayed that meeting until I had to check out to live the hotel and I must payed the price they want for that cap. Also regarding this staff were very unkind and not interesting to talk about. Bad value for this. Food was very good, even it was the same menu every morning but you can eat much as you can. I recommend to eat outside for a lunch and dinner and be free to walk and search fastfoods and restaurants with better prices, food is the same, but the prices are not even two restaurants could be side by side.

Reviews.Title: “OK but no more”
Reviews.Author: George213
Reviews.Content: +Positives : Good location, good breakfast, decent rooms - Negatives: Unfriendly and impatient Reception Staff Cockroaches in room

Reviews.Title: “A Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayshamufc
Reviews.Content: A Good hotel. However room were small, The Room We stayed in did not have proper window so we did not have any day light or sulight. great location,Walking distance to all main attraction. Breakfast was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: InterestingPlaces
Reviews.Content: Having seen the very negative reviews about the hotel I was very suspicious what I was to experience and to what extent the announced renovation bore fruit. The positive things: The hotel provides good and clean accomodation in (at least in my room and those I could take a look in) renovated rooms in a rather quit neighbourhood. For the price I paid (35â‚¬/night), you get good value for your money and a reasonably good standard. The breakfast buffet is a mixture of some hot and cold food, with among other things plenty of coffee and tea, fresh salad, cheese and goat cheese, boiled and scrumbled eggs, meat spread, various types of bread and roles, yoghurt, various types of jam, musli, chips/french fries, and apples. The breakfast room is situated on the top of the building and provides a picturesque view over the Bosporus. Rooms are equipped with hair-dryer and air-conditioning. There are some delilcious, inexpensive turkish fast-food restaurants in the surroundings. The (rather) negative things: The staff (except for those serving the breakfast!) was neither too attentive nor too polite. Everything was done and normally you got the information you asked for - which in my case was virtually everything from breakfast times to how to switch on the lights -, but do not look for the service you may be used to in especially Anglo-saxon countries. There is some variety of rooms; the window of some of them does not face the street or backyard but some pretty dark air shaft. Since I got up early and came back quite late this was no problem for me, in case you intend to work in the hotel ask for a room with a brighter and better view! The pool was out of use and, despite its 25-30Â°C, only filled with some 1/3 of water. Some of the reviews stated an aweful location. Though it actually is no district with a lot of pubs and night clubs, the next tram stop is about 5 minutes walk away, Aksaray, the last Metro station on the airport line about 10-15 minutes walk (which is pretty good when arriving late at night - reception opened 24h) away and even the old town with some 15-20 minutes in walking distance. So, you can make it anyway in a relatively short amount of time. Thus, in sum, this hotel may be a very good budget accomodation for your stay in Istanbul, which definitively is worth the money, in case you intend to walk the streets of Istanbul or have meetings at daytime. In case you are looking for good service or a location directly situated in the city centre you should opt for another hotel and/or higher category.

Reviews.Title: “perfect long week-end”
Reviews.Author: flower08
Reviews.Content: As I have always wanted to see the blue mosque in Istanbul we seized the opportunity to go mid feb2008 We thought the weather will be better than England.Unfortunately it was worst. We stay our week-end in grang ons for three night .good locations very near to all the sightseeing you can travel by tram no problems there. Hotels staff not so freindly .basic breakfast everyday. the room were basics and comfortable medium size.Overall I would say if you want to get away cheap and cheerful book your stay at grand ons. from Amer and Fareeda

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms, ok location”
Reviews.Author: MoInLondon
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3am to find that they didn't have any record of our reservation. Eventually they gave us a room, but the desk staff was not pleasant. Overall the rooms were good, good maid service and decent breakfast. The location was unknown by most cab drivers, so we learned to tell them the main road nearby instead, and then walk from there. OK location, not right in the heart of the city, but within walking distance. I probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude awakening”
Reviews.Author: ErisCordura
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel with a group of friends from Malaysia for eight nights. There were about 20 of us. Some of the staff were quite rude. It seems like the owners were desperatet o make as much money as possible out of us and would not even provide tap water for dinner. Of course they charged over the odds for bottled water so the next evening we brought our own and got told off by the head waiter. A group of Muslim academics from Malaysia cannot possibly be classed as rowdy but we were often told to keep quiet at dinner time like some schoolkids. On our last night I wanted to give a slide show to some of our friends and asked for some boiled water so I could make some apple tea so we could soak in the atmosphere properly. Even this was refused. How pathetic can that be?

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dslart
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very close to most of the atractions.Frendly people at front desc and everybody try to help you.I stayed 2nights and was OK.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Ons Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 32 Laleli Cad. Azimkar Sok. | Laleli, Istanbul 34480, Turkey
